title: Pakistan to get out of economic difficulties: PM
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 16 (APP): Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Thursday said the government was left with no choice but to raise the prices due to International Monetary Fund (IMF) deal that the government of  Pakistan Tehreek I Insaf (PTI) signed.
In tweets on social media platform Twitter, he said, “I wonder whether those who struck the worst ever deal with IMF & took patently bad economic decisions have the conscience to face the truth. How can they pretend to be innocent when what the nation is going through is clearly their doing? Details soon.”
“Acutely aware of the impact that a fuel price hike causes. Govt is left with no choice but to raise the prices due to IMF deal that PTI govt signed. Will take the nation into confidence on the specifics of the IMF-PTI deal soon. We will get out of these economic difficulties, IA,” he added.
